title: How to Level a Mobile Home

steps.title: Remove the skirting (optional on some) from around your home to gain access to the piers on which the supports sit.
steps.content: Remove the skirting (optional on some) from around your home to gain access to the piers on which the supports sit. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Begin at the middle of your mobile home to check the level at each pier.
steps.content: Begin at the middle of your mobile home to check the level at each pier. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Place a long level at the nearest pier to the center and check the bubble in the center of the level; if it is centered, the area is level.
steps.content: Place a long level at the nearest pier to the center and check the bubble in the center of the level; if it is centered, the area is level.

steps.title: Mark any piers that are not level and proceed to the next steps.
steps.content: Mark any piers that are not level and proceed to the next steps. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Attach a plastic tube to a bucket or other container with a capacity of about 5 gallons (19 L).
steps.content: Attach a plastic tube to a bucket or other container with a capacity of about 5 gallons (19 L).

steps.title: Add water to the container slowly.
steps.content: Add water to the container slowly.

steps.title: Ensure that the water in the tube is at the same level as the bottom of the I-beam on the non-level pier.
steps.content: Ensure that the water in the tube is at the same level as the bottom of the I-beam on the non-level pier. This is your level mark.

steps.title: Place a mobile home jack centered on the pier where it will support the weight of the home.
steps.content: Place a mobile home jack centered on the pier where it will support the weight of the home.

steps.title: Raise the I-beam to the level of the water level mark and check the mobile home level to ensure that the bubble is in the center of the bubble window.
steps.content: Raise the I-beam to the level of the water level mark and check the mobile home level to ensure that the bubble is in the center of the bubble window.

steps.title: Keep checking the problem areas as you jack up the area, such as doors and windows, to take note of when the problem has been corrected.
steps.content: Keep checking the problem areas as you jack up the area, such as doors and windows, to take note of when the problem has been corrected.

steps.title: Use wedges to slide under the beam to support it and keep it level when removing the jack.
steps.content: Use wedges to slide under the beam to support it and keep it level when removing the jack. [4] X Research source
